resources.string: Save content into it\'s own file
Do you really want to delete the selected items?
"An unexpected failure occurred in the last session.\nPlease copy the information about this error and send it to the creator.\nCause: "
An error happened, please restart the app
Name can\'t be longer than 150 characters!
No objects of this type were found
"Storage access was necessary to use this dir: "

Chapters are created from the \'more\' menu.\nThey have only the basic information as well, but in addition to that, they have an option to have their own file, where all items inside them will be saved (used for quicker load when there are many items stored, e. g. 100 words).

All items created from the 'more' menu (all except References) in the top right corner have two columns for name of the new item and for its description (optional).
The description of the item can be multiline.
After you are done with these two colums, there can be more stuff for each different type of item.
When you are done with all that information, click 'OK' to create the item, or whenever you want to cancel the action click 'Cancel' or click outside the window to exit the dialog.

Subjects are created from the \'more\' menu.\nThey have just the basic information described above.\nDirectory of the created subject will be called after the specified name, therefore the name can contain only file usable characters.

Pictures are created from the 'more' menu.
Other than the basic information they contain an 'Add image' button, which brings up an image chooser.
After selecting an image to add, there will be added an image item consisting of its name and the image itself.
In decision to remove any image, click on the red cross on the right of the name of that image.

References are created using \'Reference\' button in selecting mode.\nAfter selecting items to reference click the \'Reference\' button, then find the chapter you want to put it in and click the \'Paste\' button.\nThese objects can\'t be edited, only removed, but they refer to any other type of item except Subjects and References.

Words are created from the 'more' menu.
Other than the basic information they contain an 'Add translate' button, which adds a translate item bellow.
Translates consist of name and optional description.
In decision to remove any translate, click on the red cross on the right of the specified translate.
This application has some more functions that can sometimes help. Here is the list and explanation of them.

If you want to use some external subject folders, this is the way to go.
For external subjects import select more options and than 'Import subject'.
You can select multiple subject folders at a time.
After selecting desired subject folders, click 'Import'.
Remove them from the list by tapping on the red button on the right side.

If you have similar names of certain words, and they have identical translations, combine them using these: /().
Slash character signals two different options ending by a whitespace, an interpunction character or a bracket.
Examples:
I/They come = 'I come' or 'They come'
(I go)/(He goes). = 'I go.' or 'He goes'.

File chapters can be added using 'Add chapter from file' button found in the more options menu.
Select the file of the desired chapter, written in JSON format, and it will be added into the currently opened location of a subject.
Any pictures or file chapters included in the loaded file have to be copied manually.
It is highly recommended not to import subject files.

Export words by opening a chapter which content you want to export and select \'Export words\' option in the more options menu.\nThan just select the file you want to add the current word content in.\nThe exported words can be imported again without loss.

Searching is enabled in all chapters and subjects.\nTyped text is kept in the search field even when it\'s not visible.\nThere are various methods for searching, the search engine accepts naming syntax.
Regex Quantifiers\nThe quantifiers specify the number of occurrences of a character.
Regex Metacharacters\nThe regular expression metacharacters work as shortcuts.

This application has 4 searching methods.
1.	prefix \ or no prefix, standard search, whether an item contains the given expression
2.	prefix \s: start, whether an item starts with the given expression
3.	prefix \e: end, whether an item ends with the given expression
4.	prefix : searching using regex (regular expression)
Permanently deletes the selected items after accepting the delete-check dialog.

Only one item can be edited at a time, that item can not be a reference. A window with parameters of the selected item pops up. The style of the editing window is same when creating that type of item.

All created objects can be modified in some way.
There are two ways to get into select mode.
	1. Long-pressing an item brings up the bottom sheet with possible actions. Long-press also toggles the item selection state as well as tapping the checkbox showing that state.
	2. Tapping on the 'select' button in the top right corner (pencil icon) also brings up the bottom options sheet. Repeated clicking selects all items of the list or (if all items are selected) exits the selection mode.
Cuts all selected items and shows the paste sheet (cancel and paste buttons). After opening the desired directory click \'Paste\'.

While in search list a click opens the path where the item is in. Otherwise shows the paste sheet (cancel and paste buttons). After opening the desired directory click \'Paste\' to create all references for the selected items.

Find the directory where you want to have all school subjects.
Then select that directory by a long-click or check it and than click 'Set source'.
Now this directory will be the primary source of subjects and all created subjects will be saved into that directory.
If you want to return to the current subjects dir select the 'Go to current directory' option in the more menu.
There are two test types - words and pictures.\nYou can choose the test\'s length, number of tested items and test type.\nThe test can only contain items from one subject.
After the time is up or you finished the test a window with the test\'s success rate and all tested items.\nEvery item shows its hint, correct answer and your answer.

After pressing the button \'Start\' the test is started and the remaining time can be seen in the top.\nWhen you are done with the test click \'Done\' to submit the test.\nWhenever you decide to abolish the test press twice the back button.

The variety of items to create the test from can be added to using the \'Add source\' button.\nThen a item chooser pops up, where you can repeatedly select items for the test (but only from on one subject).
Recount success rate of this chapter
Translate all words on every click
